definition: nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: If the clouds come down there's no way out.
sentences.chinese: 如果烏雲壓下來就會無路可走了。

sentences.english: When the "king" of one side has no way out, then it is "checkmated".
sentences.chinese: 當一方的“王”無路可走時，成爲被“將死”。

sentences.english: Sometimes goodbye is the only way.
sentences.chinese: 縝有時候，除了說再見，無路可走。

sentences.english: When faced with impasse, wriggling through the middle does not have to be dishonourable.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼前無路可走，選擇從中間悄然而過也並不可恥。

sentences.english: Others take the road to let others gave no way out!
sentences.chinese: 一部分人攔着路讓其他人無路可走。

sentences.english: We'll be blocked if the dark clouds fall downwards.
sentences.chinese: 如果烏雲壓下來就會無路可走了。

sentences.english: There is no captive audience online.
sentences.chinese: 網上沒有無路可走的受衆。
無路可走的受衆都死光了。

sentences.english: Driven to desperation, my grandfather hanged himself on a tree beside our ancestral graves.
sentences.chinese: 被逼得無路可走，我祖父在祖墳旁的一棵樹上吊死了。

sentences.english: If the clouds cover, there will be no way to walk.
sentences.chinese: 如果烏雲壓下來就會無路可走了。

sentences.english: Without a captive audience, there's no such thing as "advertising" any more.
sentences.chinese: 沒有無路可走的受衆，就再也沒有所謂的“廣告”了。

definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
authentic
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to cower/to flinch/to quail/to recoil
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to capitulate
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to advise
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
